Ada Drainase Tersumbat di Cimahi? Silakan Lapor Lewat Medsos Wali Kota
06 Nov 2019, 14:27 by Ririn Nur Febriani
MUSIM hujan telah tiba, genangan mulai muncul di jalanan Kota Cimahi. Sampah yang menyumbat saluran drainase kerap memicu terjadinya banjir, menjadi kewajiban semua pihak untuk memastikan saluran bebas sampah.
Seperti hujan deras yang berlangsung pada Rabu 6 November 2019. Air terlihat melimpas ke ruas jalan hingga memicu kemacetan arus lalu lintas.Wali Kota Cimahi, Ajay M Priatna meminta masyarakat aktif menjaga kebersihan lingkungan. Terutama memperhatikan kondisi saluran drainase dan aliran sungai di permukiman.
"Musim hujan telah tiba, mari bersama-sama bantu Cimahi yang kita cintai ini bebas dari banjir. Kebersihan lingkungan bagian dari tanggungjawab bersama," ujarnya, Rabu 6 November 2019.
Selain mengajak masyarakat menjaga kebersihan, pihaknya meminta masyarakat melaporkan kondisi drainase yang tersumbat. Laporan tersebut bakal ditindaklanjuti oleh dinas terkait.
"Silakan informasikan ke saya, titik di rumah warga yang drainasenya tersumbat oleh sampah. Mohon kirimkan foto serta lokasi drainase tersebut ke akun media sosial. Saya akan segera berkordinasi dengan dinas terkait untuk segera membersihkan sampah di daerah," ungkapnya.
Jika sudah dibersihkan, masyarakat harus menjaga kebersihannya dengan tidak buang sampah sembarangan. "Mari bersama jaga kebersihan Kota Cimahi," katanya.
Dinas Pekerjaan Umum dan Penataan Ruang (PUPR) Kota Cimahi mengklaim pengerjaan revitalisasi drainase yang sudah dilakukan memberi dampak positif meski masih tersisa titik genangan karena penanganan dilakukan bertahap.
"Memang masih ada genangan, tapi dalam 30 menit bisa langsung surut lagi. Kami kira kondisi ini sudah cukup siginifikan dalam progres penanganan banjir," ujar Kepala Bidang Bina Marga Dinas PUPR Kota Cimahi, Wilman Sugiansyah.***

Is There Drainage Is Clogged in Cimahi? Please report through the Mayor's Social Media
Nov 6, 2019, 14:27 by Ririn Nur Febriani
SEASON rain has arrived, puddles began to appear on the streets of Cimahi City. Garbage clogging the drainage canal often triggers flooding, it is the duty of all parties to ensure that the channel is free of rubbish.
Like a heavy rain that took place on Wednesday 6 November 2019. Water was seen running down the road to trigger traffic jams. Cimahi Mayor, Ajay M Priatna asked the community to actively maintain environmental cleanliness. Especially pay attention to the condition of drainage channels and river flow in settlements.
"The rainy season has arrived, let us together help our beloved Cimahi free from flooding. Environmental cleanliness is part of our shared responsibility," he said, Wednesday, November 6, 2019.
In addition to inviting the community to maintain cleanliness, he asked the community to report the condition of blocked drainage. The report will be followed up by related agencies.
"Please inform me, the point in the homes of residents whose drainage is clogged with rubbish. Please send photos and drainage locations to social media accounts. I will immediately coordinate with related agencies to immediately clean up trash in the area," he said.
If it has been cleaned, the community must maintain its cleanliness by not littering. "Let's keep the Cimahi City clean," he said.
The Cimahi City Public Works and Spatial Planning Office (PUPR) claims that the drainage revitalization work that has been carried out has a positive impact even though there is still a puddle point because the handling is done in stages.
"Indeed there is still a puddle, but in 30 minutes it can immediately recede again. We think this condition is already quite significant in the progress of flood management," said Head of Cimahi PUPR Office of Public Works, Wilman Sugiansyah. ***
